intro: Blepharis baguirmiensis, commonly known as the Baguirmi grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces delicate white or pale blue flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
